An image, likeness, bust. From eiko; a likeness, i.e. statue, profile, or representation, resemblance.
And, even, also, namely.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

11.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
11.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

11.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Sculpture; engraving, a stamp, sign. From the same as charax; a scratch or etching, i.e. Stamp, or scupltured figure.

11.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Neuter 3rd Person Singular
11.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

12.str2: From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.

12.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
12.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

12.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
12.str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An ordinance, injunction, command, law. From entellomai; injunction, i.e. An authoritative prescription.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

13.str2: And, even, also, namely.

13.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
13.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

13.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Feminine Singular
13.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

13.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
13.str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

13.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
13.str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.
Yes, certainly, even so. A primary particle of strong affirmation; yes.
